issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.summary: Create a micro benchmark tool for vectorization to evaluate the performance gain after SIMD optimization

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: update of bucketing column should not be allowed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12708493 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Code changes look fine.  A new negative test that checks this should also be added.  The test failures look relevant.
[~alangates], new patch fixes the tests and adds a negative one.  Could you look at TestHiveAuthorizerCheckInvocation.testUpdateSomeColumnsUsed() - I'm not clear on why getColumns() changes.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12708808 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

I don't think these failures a related to the patch.
For example, http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/3249/#showFailuresLink, has the same TestMiniSpartOnYarnCliDriver failures.  smb_mapjoin_8.q also appears in other bot runs w/o this patch.

+1, looks good.

bq. TestHiveAuthorizerCheckInvocation.testUpdateSomeColumnsUsed() - I'm not clear on why getColumns() changes.
The bucketing column has to be read as part of the inbound query so that the update knows how to bucket the columns on the way out.  Since you added a separate bucketing column now it has to be read also.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed
